title: Recovery Techniques for Finite Element Methods
abstract:
Post-processing techniques are essential tools for enhancing the accuracy of
finite element approximations and achieving superconvergence. Among these,
recovery techniques stand out as vital methods, playing significant roles in
both post-processing and pre-processing. This paper provides an overview of
recent developments in recovery techniques and their applications in adaptive
computations. The discussion encompasses both gradient recovery and Hessian
recovery methods. To establish the superconvergence properties of these
techniques, two theoretical frameworks are introduced. Applications of these
methods are demonstrated in constructing asymptotically exact {\it a
posteriori} error estimators for second-order elliptic equations, fourth-order
elliptic equations, and interface problems. Numerical experiments are performed
to evaluate the asymptotic exactness of recovery type a posteriori error
estimators.
